title: Hint
text:
1) Start with the given expression:
(63m⁴ - 42m³) / $$(-7m²)$$.

2) Separate each term in the numerator over the denominator:
$$=$$ (63m⁴ / $$(-7m²))$$ - (42m³ / $$(-7m²))$$.

3) Simplify each fraction:
a) 63m⁴ / $$(-7m²)$$ $$=$$ (63 / -7) × $$m^{4-2}$$ $$=$$ -9m².
b) -(42m³ / $$(-7m²))$$ $$=$$ (-42 / -7) × $$m^{3-2}$$ $$=$$ $$6m$$.

4) Combine the results:
-9m² + $$6m$$.

Answer: -9m² + $$6m$$.
